summary: This FBI electronic communication documents the FedEx shipment of an original OIG waiver signed by Jermaine Darden from the New York FBI office to the DOJ Office of the Inspector General's New York Field Office. It confirms the tracking and delivery of the waiver related to the Jeffrey Epstein death investigation.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Named as the subject of the death investigation in the document's synopsis.

persons.name: Jermaine Darden
persons.context: Signed the OIG waiver prior to his interview on August 13, 2019, which was then shipped via FedEx.

events.title: Jermaine Darden interview
events.description: Jermaine Darden was interviewed and signed an OIG waiver prior to the interview.

events.title: FedEx shipment arranged
events.description: Special Agent arranged to have the original OIG waiver signed by Jermaine Darden mailed via FedEx Standard Overnight Delivery to the DOJ OIG.

events.title: FedEx delivery confirmed
events.description: The FedEx shipment containing the OIG waiver was delivered to the DOJ Office of the Inspector General at approximately 10:32 AM.

locations: One Battery Park Plaza, 29th Floor, New York, NY 10004
keyFacts: The document is part of the FBI's investigation into the death of Jeffrey Epstein (case ID 90A-NY-3151227).
An OIG waiver signed by Jermaine Darden prior to his interview on August 13, 2019, was shipped via FedEx to the DOJ Office of the Inspector General.
The FedEx tracking number was 4744 7648 2385, and delivery was confirmed on August 26, 2019, at approximately 10:32 AM.
The document indicates procedural steps in the death investigation, specifically the handling of witness documentation.
The recipient address was the U.S. Department of Justice Office of the Inspector General, New York Field Office.
